faqs.question: What is the average price range when I plan to buy house in Sector 30
faqs.answer: The price range for houses in Sector 30 is quite broad due to the varying plot sizes and construction quality. Generally, a mid-sized independent house or a premium builder floor starts from approximately INR 2 Crores and can go up significantly to INR 5 Crores or more for large villas on 10 to 14 Marla plots. Factors like road-facing direction, corner location, and interior finish heavily influence the final price, so consulting a local expert is highly recommended for accurate valuation.

faqs.question: Are there any newly constructed builder floors available in Sector 30 or only old houses
faqs.answer: Sector 30 is experiencing significant redevelopment, meaning there is a healthy mix of both old, established homes and brand-new, modern builder floors. Many older properties are being reconstructed into contemporary floors offering lifts, dedicated parking, and premium amenities. If you prefer modern architecture and new construction, highly-finished builder floors are readily available for immediate purchase.

faqs.question: What documentation should I check before finalizing a deal to buy property in Sector 30
faqs.answer: Essential documentation includes verifying the clear title deed, ensuring the property has an updated mutation record, checking the completion or occupancy certificate, and confirming all utility bills are settled. Buyers must also inspect the building plan approval from the relevant municipal authorities. Always engage a reputable property lawyer to conduct thorough due diligence before making any payment.
